snippet: The Government Accountability Office found that many doctors who recommended a common prostate cancer therapy had financial relationships with treatment providers.
abstract: Government Accountability Office says doctors who have a financial interest in radiation treatment centers are much more likely to prescribe such treatments for patients with prostate cancer; says Medicare beneficiaries are often unaware that their doctors stand to profit from use of radiation therapy.
lead_paragraph: The Government Accountability Office found that many doctors who recommended a common prostate cancer therapy had financial relationships with treatment providers.

headline.main: Doctors Who Profit From Radiation Prescribe It More Often, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Doctors Who Profit From Radiation Prescribe It More Often, Study Finds
